item.description: Dry Hopped Kombucha # Dry hopping is a process borrowed from beer brewing where hops are soaked in the fermenting/fermented beer to infuse the fruity and floral hop flavors without adding much bitterness. Think very hop forward beers like IPAs. This is in contrast to traditional hop additions to beer during boiling which add a large chunk of bitterness (this is useful to offset the very sweet wort). I have found hops to be a delightful addition to kombucha.
